text: <@U1B4121BP>: and <@U0260V4K1>  <@U0HPGQ4KH> <@U02E3CRMA> just got confirmation from iontank that even though the pixel densityof lights have changed - the physical dimensions are the same as our goldspike cubby
lights are more integrated than goldspike? no cheap plastic or aluminium profile visible? <@U0ML49XU0>
hey <@U02F9CXTL> and <@U0J6TE0CA> are you done with your list?
if so, can we run through it together?

<!here|@here>: 

hey ya’ll, here’s the plan we discussed.  please read and respond where i’ve asked for input.

We have a new baseline for performance!  In order to get us additional head room, we’re proposing that we scale the experience across 3 production boxes:
1) Top Sweep
2) Cluster 1 of Cubbies
2) Cluster 2 of cubbies.

Accordingly, the following needs to happen today:
<@U0H4SJN11>:  is helping me spec the computer needs.  I’ll float by google, we’ll order and build.
In parallel, <@U0EL0GLEL>  is cleaning up his code in accordance with this new software architecture.
- evaluate touch 
- remove scroll bars
- figure out communication to Data Viz 

Goal for today:
1.  Float hardware impact with Google
2.  <@U0EL0GLEL>  to stabilize his code and discuss any other code impact with Dennis

Tomorrow, we get back on our creative review and feature audit workflow.

In order to do so, we need Peter to collect and integrate all the iterative features Bryan and Destin have compiled locally.

Tomorrow at lunch, I’d like <@U0EL0GLEL>  to take us through the experience on the wall, end to end.  
We’ll then take 30-45 to get critical on Retrospective and Quiet modes - cut a task list and being to execute against it.
i know this performance stuff has been a bear, but it looks really really great

<!here|@here>: EOD re-cap

- we sent hardware impact to Google
- <@U0EL0GLEL> stabilized the code; we’re split between top sweep on one machine, cubbies on another (and the third segement of cubbies is awaiting a new computer-home)
- <@U11JK4QSK> sent through his local code to Peter.  Peter is beginnging to integrate
- <@U1JDZG8AF> wil do same tomorrow

Right now, <@U0EL0GLEL> is shifting his focus towards reviewing creative tomorrow.  It’s our intention to look at the latest and greatest on the wall and then deep dive on Goodbye and Quiet modes.  

<@U0EL0GLEL>: in addiiton to integrating the latest code, I pegged the following tickets as good to get out of the way before we focus on specific modes.  let me know how you plan to proceed so that we’re ready for tomorrow.
